poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of the Crescent"

Under the sting of the scorching sun,
In the heartland of sorrow and spilt blood,
Speakers of peace sound their loaded guns.
Gaza, poor child, dressed in dust,
In pain's throbbing refrain,
Wails of the detained echo and rust.
God's children, prey of power,
In cruelty's laps, lie wasted hours. 
Oh despair, nude in the marketplace,
Where is God's face?
